resources.string: What Sparki should do when the battery is charged

SSID is the name of the Wifi network your device will be on while charging.

Leaving this blank will let Sparki message the associated URL no matter what WiFi network your device is onâ€¦ even over data.

Leaving SSID blank is not recommended, as Sparki might message devices you didn't intend him to.
Time to wait before Sparki sends repeat reminders.\n\nA setting of 00 minutes will mean no repeat reminders are sent.
Time until Sparki turns off the alarm, without power being disconnected.\n\nA setting of 00 minutes will mean the alarm does not timeout.
Take Me To The Optimizer Settings

Sometimes Sparki will be prevented from running in the background by your device. If you are having trouble, either with Sparki not reminding you when the battery is charged or Sparki not properly starting when you reboot your device, first take a look at the battery optimizer and make sure Sparki is not being optimized.\n\nDon\'t worry too much about the battery life impact; Sparki doesn\'t work too hard and when he does it\'s almost exclusively while the battery is charging.

Unfortunately, Sparki can\'t know which WiFi network your device is on without location permissions being granted, so he can ask android. The poor old boy\'s eyesight isn\'t very good, and unfortunately can\'t see you have put him down beside the same plug you always do. If you withhold location permissions only entries with an empty SSID entry will work.\n\nDon\'t worry though, Sparki doesn\'t collect any of your data (location or otherwise). You, or anyone else, can confirm that for yourselves, as Sparki\'s code is open source and available on GitHub.
Don\'t forget Sparki needs location permissions while running in the background as well!
Keep reminding me until I notice
Sparki needs to be given notification permissions to:
show you when he is working in the background
inform you when the battery has charged
Make sure to enable background location, it is the only way Sparki will know what network you are on while the screen is off.
